model_diff:
## Map Overview
*   **General Information**: The map displays a severe weather outlook for Arkansas for Thursday, March 14, 2024 (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini).
*   **Source and Timing**: It was last updated on March 13, 2024, at 12:35 PM CDT, is valid until March 15, 2024, at 7:00 AM CDT, and is produced by the NOAA National Weather Service Storm Prediction Center (3 of 3 Claude).
*   **Focus Area**: The map specifically highlights Arkansas with a bold or black outline (2 of 3 Claude).

## Risk Levels and Color Coding
*   **Categorization**: Different areas are categorized by risk levels for severe weather, represented by various colors (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini). The risk levels decrease in severity from higher to lower risk (1 of 3 GPT).
*   **Risk Level Naming**:
    *   Risk levels mentioned include Enhanced (Level 3), Slight (Level 2), Marginal (Level 1), and Thunderstorms (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude).
    *   Additional levels of High (Magenta) and Moderate (Red) were identified, along with Enhanced (Orange), Slight (Yellow), Marginal (Tan/Dark Green), and Thunderstorms (Green/Light Green) (3 of 3 Gemini). *Note: One response used inconsistent color associations for risk levels (1 of 3 GPT).*

## Cities by Risk Level
*   **High Risk (Magenta/Red)**: No cities were explicitly within this zone, although Mountain Home was noted as being very close to its border (3 of 3 Gemini). One report indicated no cities under "High Risk (Red)" (1 of 3 GPT).
*   **Moderate Risk (Red/Orange)**:
    *   Cities listed include Harrison (2 of 3 Gemini), Mountain Home (2 of 3 Gemini - *also noted as close to edge/mostly in Enhanced*), Batesville (2 of 3 Gemini), and Fayetteville (1 of 3 Gemini).
    *   One report listed Fayetteville, Fort Smith, Harrison, Russellville, Conway, and Batesville under "Moderate Risk (Orange)" (1 of 3 GPT).
*   **Enhanced Risk (Orange/Yellow)**: *Note: Significant disagreement exists between models on which cities fall into this category versus Moderate or Slight risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Russellville (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini) and Conway (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini).
    *   Fort Smith (3 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini).
    *   Harrison (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude) - *Gemini placed Harrison in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mountain Home (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 1 of 3 Gemini - *as mostly Enhanced*) - *Gemini also placed Mountain Home in/near Moderate or High Risk*.
    *   Batesville (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 1 of 3 Gemini) - *Gemini also placed Batesville in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (2 of 3 GPT, 1 of 3 Claude, 2 of 3 Gemini) - *Some reports placed Fayetteville in Slight or Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mena (1 of 3 GPT, 1 of 3 Gemini) - *Others placed Mena in Slight Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (1 of 3 Claude - *on edge*, 3 of 3 Gemini - *on edge/in*) - *Others placed Jonesboro in Slight Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (2 of 3 Gemini) - *Others placed Hot Springs in Slight Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (2 of 3 Gemini) - *Others placed Little Rock in Slight Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (1 of 3 Gemini) - *Others placed West Memphis in Slight Risk*.
    *   Arkadelphia (1 of 3 Gemini) - *Others placed Arkadelphia in Slight Risk*.
    *   *One report listed Mountain Home, Jonesboro, Mena, Hot Springs, and Little Rock under "Enhanced Risk (Yellow)" (1 of 3 GPT).*
*   **Slight Risk (Yellow/Dark Green)**: *Note: Disagreements exist, with some cities alternately placed in Enhanced Risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Texarkana (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini), Pine Bluff (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini), and El Dorado (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 3 of 3 Gemini).
    *   Arkadelphia (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 2 of 3 Gemini) - *One report placed Arkadelphia in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 1 of 3 Gemini) - *Some reports placed Little Rock in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude) - *Some reports placed Hot Springs in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Claude, 2 of 3 Gemini) - *One report placed West Memphis in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (2 of 3 GPT, 2 of 3 Claude, 1 of 3 Gemini - *parts of*) - *Some reports placed Jonesboro fully or partially in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Mena (1 of 3 GPT, 2 of 3 Claude) - *Some reports placed Mena in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (2 of 3 Claude) - *Most reports placed Fayetteville in Enhanced or Moderate Risk*.
    *   *One report listed West Memphis, Arkadelphia, Pine Bluff, Texarkana, and El Dorado under "Slight Risk (Dark Green)" (1 of 3 GPT).*
*   **Marginal Risk (Dark Green/Tan/Light Green)**: This area was described as covering regions surrounding other risk zones (2 of 3 GPT), the eastern and western edges/borders of the state (3 of 3 Claude), extending beyond other areas to cover a substantial part of the state (1 of 3 Gemini), or covering the eastern portion of the state (2 of 3 Gemini). No specific cities were listed within this zone (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Gemini). *One report used the color "Light Green" for this risk level (1 of 3 GPT).*
*   **Thunderstorms (Light Green/Green)**: This area was described as being further out or the outermost area (2 of 3 GPT), covering the far eastern portions (1 of 3 Gemini), or covering the southwestern, southeastern, and northeastern corners of the state (2 of 3 Gemini). No specific cities were listed within this zone (2 of 3 GPT, 3 of 3 Gemini). *One report stated no areas were marked for only thunderstorms (1 of 3 GPT).*
var_only:
## Map Overview
*   **General Information**: The map displays a severe weather outlook for Arkansas for Thursday, March 14, 2024 .
*   **Source and Timing**: It was last updated on March 13, 2024, at 12:35 PM CDT, is valid until March 15, 2024, at 7:00 AM CDT, and is produced by the NOAA National Weather Service Storm Prediction Center .
*   **Focus Area**: The map specifically highlights Arkansas with a bold or black outline .

## Risk Levels and Color Coding
*   **Categorization**: Different areas are categorized by risk levels for severe weather, represented by various colors . The risk levels decrease in severity from higher to lower risk .
*   **Risk Level Naming**:
    *   Risk levels mentioned include Enhanced , Slight , Marginal , and Thunderstorms .
    *   Additional levels of High  and Moderate  were identified, along with Enhanced , Slight , Marginal , and Thunderstorms  . *Note: One response used inconsistent color associations for risk levels .*

## Cities by Risk Level
*   **High Risk **: No cities were explicitly within this zone, although Mountain Home was noted as being very close to its border . One report indicated no cities under "High Risk " .
*   **Moderate Risk **:
    *   Cities listed include Harrison , Mountain Home , Batesville , and Fayetteville .
    *   One report listed Fayetteville, Fort Smith, Harrison, Russellville, Conway, and Batesville under "Moderate Risk " .
*   **Enhanced Risk **: *Note: Significant disagreement exists between models on which cities fall into this category versus Moderate or Slight risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Russellville  and Conway .
    *   Fort Smith .
    *   Harrison  - *Gemini placed Harrison in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mountain Home  - *Gemini also placed Mountain Home in/near Moderate or High Risk*.
    *   Batesville  - *Gemini also placed Batesville in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville  - *Some reports placed Fayetteville in Slight or Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mena  - *Others placed Mena in Slight Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro  - *Others placed Jonesboro in Slight Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs  - *Others placed Hot Springs in Slight Risk*.
    *   Little Rock  - *Others placed Little Rock in Slight Risk*.
    *   West Memphis  - *Others placed West Memphis in Slight Risk*.
    *   Arkadelphia  - *Others placed Arkadelphia in Slight Risk*.
    *   *One report listed Mountain Home, Jonesboro, Mena, Hot Springs, and Little Rock under "Enhanced Risk " .*
*   **Slight Risk **: *Note: Disagreements exist, with some cities alternately placed in Enhanced Risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Texarkana , Pine Bluff , and El Dorado .
    *   Arkadelphia  - *One report placed Arkadelphia in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Little Rock  - *Some reports placed Little Rock in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs  - *Some reports placed Hot Springs in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   West Memphis  - *One report placed West Memphis in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro  - *Some reports placed Jonesboro fully or partially in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Mena  - *Some reports placed Mena in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville  - *Most reports placed Fayetteville in Enhanced or Moderate Risk*.
    *   *One report listed West Memphis, Arkadelphia, Pine Bluff, Texarkana, and El Dorado under "Slight Risk " .*
*   **Marginal Risk **: This area was described as covering regions surrounding other risk zones , the eastern and western edges/borders of the state , extending beyond other areas to cover a substantial part of the state , or covering the eastern portion of the state . No specific cities were listed within this zone . *One report used the color "Light Green" for this risk level .*
*   **Thunderstorms **: This area was described as being further out or the outermost area , covering the far eastern portions , or covering the southwestern, southeastern, and northeastern corners of the state . No specific cities were listed within this zone . *One report stated no areas were marked for only thunderstorms .*

## Map Overview
*   **General Information**: The map displays a severe weather outlook for Arkansas for Thursday, March 14, 2024 (300%).
*   **Source and Timing**: It was last updated on March 13, 2024, at 12:35 PM CDT, is valid until March 15, 2024, at 7:00 AM CDT, and is produced by the NOAA National Weather Service Storm Prediction Center (100%).
*   **Focus Area**: The map specifically highlights Arkansas with a bold or black outline (67%).

## Risk Levels and Color Coding
*   **Categorization**: Different areas are categorized by risk levels for severe weather, represented by various colors (300%). The risk levels decrease in severity from higher to lower risk (33%).
*   **Risk Level Naming**:
    *   Risk levels mentioned include Enhanced (0%), Slight (0%), Marginal (0%), and Thunderstorms (200%).
    *   Additional levels of High (0%) and Moderate (0%) were identified, along with Enhanced (0%), Slight (0%), Marginal (0%), and Thunderstorms (0%) (100%). *Note: One response used inconsistent color associations for risk levels (33%).*

## Cities by Risk Level
*   **High Risk (0%)**: No cities were explicitly within this zone, although Mountain Home was noted as being very close to its border (100%). One report indicated no cities under "High Risk (0%)" (33%).
*   **Moderate Risk (0%)**:
    *   Cities listed include Harrison (67%), Mountain Home (67%), Batesville (67%), and Fayetteville (33%).
    *   One report listed Fayetteville, Fort Smith, Harrison, Russellville, Conway, and Batesville under "Moderate Risk (0%)" (33%).
*   **Enhanced Risk (0%)**: *Note: Significant disagreement exists between models on which cities fall into this category versus Moderate or Slight risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Russellville (300%) and Conway (300%).
    *   Fort Smith (300%).
    *   Harrison (167%) - *Gemini placed Harrison in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mountain Home (200%) - *Gemini also placed Mountain Home in/near Moderate or High Risk*.
    *   Batesville (200%) - *Gemini also placed Batesville in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (167%) - *Some reports placed Fayetteville in Slight or Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mena (67%) - *Others placed Mena in Slight Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (133%) - *Others placed Jonesboro in Slight Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (67%) - *Others placed Hot Springs in Slight Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (67%) - *Others placed Little Rock in Slight Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (33%) - *Others placed West Memphis in Slight Risk*.
    *   Arkadelphia (33%) - *Others placed Arkadelphia in Slight Risk*.
    *   *One report listed Mountain Home, Jonesboro, Mena, Hot Springs, and Little Rock under "Enhanced Risk (0%)" (33%).*
*   **Slight Risk (0%)**: *Note: Disagreements exist, with some cities alternately placed in Enhanced Risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Texarkana (267%), Pine Bluff (267%), and El Dorado (267%).
    *   Arkadelphia (233%) - *One report placed Arkadelphia in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (200%) - *Some reports placed Little Rock in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (167%) - *Some reports placed Hot Springs in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (233%) - *One report placed West Memphis in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (167%) - *Some reports placed Jonesboro fully or partially in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Mena (100%) - *Some reports placed Mena in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (67%) - *Most reports placed Fayetteville in Enhanced or Moderate Risk*.
    *   *One report listed West Memphis, Arkadelphia, Pine Bluff, Texarkana, and El Dorado under "Slight Risk (0%)" (33%).*
*   **Marginal Risk (0%)**: This area was described as covering regions surrounding other risk zones (67%), the eastern and western edges/borders of the state (100%), extending beyond other areas to cover a substantial part of the state (33%), or covering the eastern portion of the state (67%). No specific cities were listed within this zone (167%). *One report used the color "Light Green" for this risk level (33%).*
*   **Thunderstorms (0%)**: This area was described as being further out or the outermost area (67%), covering the far eastern portions (33%), or covering the southwestern, southeastern, and northeastern corners of the state (67%). No specific cities were listed within this zone (167%). *One report stated no areas were marked for only thunderstorms (33%).*

## Map Overview
*   **General Information**: The map displays a severe weather outlook for Arkansas for Thursday, March 14, 2024 (very little support).
*   **Source and Timing**: It was last updated on March 13, 2024, at 12:35 PM CDT, is valid until March 15, 2024, at 7:00 AM CDT, and is produced by the NOAA National Weather Service Storm Prediction Center (very little support).
*   **Focus Area**: The map specifically highlights Arkansas with a bold or black outline (very little support).

## Risk Levels and Color Coding
*   **Categorization**: Different areas are categorized by risk levels for severe weather, represented by various colors (very little support). The risk levels decrease in severity from higher to lower risk (very little support).
*   **Risk Level Naming**:
    *   Risk levels mentioned include Enhanced (very little support), Slight (very little support), Marginal (very little support), and Thunderstorms (very little support).
    *   Additional levels of High (Magenta) and Moderate (Red) were identified, along with Enhanced (Orange), Slight (Yellow), Marginal (Tan/Dark Green), and Thunderstorms (Green/Light Green) (very little support). *Note: One response used inconsistent color associations for risk levels (very little support).*

## Cities by Risk Level
*   **High Risk (Magenta/Red)**: No cities were explicitly within this zone, although Mountain Home was noted as being very close to its border (very little support). One report indicated no cities under "High Risk (Red)" (very little support).
*   **Moderate Risk (Red/Orange)**:
    *   Cities listed include Harrison (very little support), Mountain Home (very little support), Batesville (very little support), and Fayetteville (very little support).
    *   One report listed Fayetteville, Fort Smith, Harrison, Russellville, Conway, and Batesville under "Moderate Risk (Orange)" (very little support).
*   **Enhanced Risk (Orange/Yellow)**: *Note: Significant disagreement exists between models on which cities fall into this category versus Moderate or Slight risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Russellville (very little support) and Conway (very little support).
    *   Fort Smith (very little support).
    *   Harrison (very little support) - *Gemini placed Harrison in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mountain Home (very little support) - *Gemini also placed Mountain Home in/near Moderate or High Risk*.
    *   Batesville (very little support) - *Gemini also placed Batesville in Moderate Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (very little support) - *Some reports placed Fayetteville in Slight or Moderate Risk*.
    *   Mena (very little support) - *Others placed Mena in Slight Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (very little support) - *Others placed Jonesboro in Slight Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (very little support) - *Others placed Hot Springs in Slight Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (very little support) - *Others placed Little Rock in Slight Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (very little support) - *Others placed West Memphis in Slight Risk*.
    *   Arkadelphia (very little support) - *Others placed Arkadelphia in Slight Risk*.
    *   *One report listed Mountain Home, Jonesboro, Mena, Hot Springs, and Little Rock under "Enhanced Risk (Yellow)" (very little support).*
*   **Slight Risk (Yellow/Dark Green)**: *Note: Disagreements exist, with some cities alternately placed in Enhanced Risk.*
    *   Cities consistently listed by most include: Texarkana (very little support), Pine Bluff (very little support), and El Dorado (very little support).
    *   Arkadelphia (very little support) - *One report placed Arkadelphia in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Little Rock (very little support) - *Some reports placed Little Rock in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Hot Springs (very little support) - *Some reports placed Hot Springs in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   West Memphis (very little support) - *One report placed West Memphis in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Jonesboro (very little support) - *Some reports placed Jonesboro fully or partially in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Mena (very little support) - *Some reports placed Mena in Enhanced Risk*.
    *   Fayetteville (very little support) - *Most reports placed Fayetteville in Enhanced or Moderate Risk*.
    *   *One report listed West Memphis, Arkadelphia, Pine Bluff, Texarkana, and El Dorado under "Slight Risk (Dark Green)" (very little support).*
*   **Marginal Risk (Dark Green/Tan/Light Green)**: This area was described as covering regions surrounding other risk zones (very little support), the eastern and western edges/borders of the state (very little support), extending beyond other areas to cover a substantial part of the state (very little support), or covering the eastern portion of the state (very little support). No specific cities were listed within this zone (very little support). *One report used the color "Light Green" for this risk level (very little support).*
*   **Thunderstorms (Light Green/Green)**: This area was described as being further out or the outermost area (very little support), covering the far eastern portions (very little support), or covering the southwestern, southeastern, and northeastern corners of the state (very little support). No specific cities were listed within this zone (very little support). *One report stated no areas were marked for only thunderstorms (very little support).*
similarity:
- The map displays a severe weather outlook specifically for Arkansas, valid for Thursday, March 14, 2024, with details produced by the NOAA National Weather Service Storm Prediction Center and last updated on March 13, 2024, at 12:35 PM CDT, remaining effective until March 15, 2024, at 7:00 AM CDT.
- The map categorizes areas by risk levels for severe weather using various colors, with risk levels including Enhanced, Slight, and Marginal, which decrease in severity.
- The categorization includes Enhanced (Orange), Slight (Yellow), Marginal (Tan/Dark Green), and Thunderstorms (Green/Light Green).
- Cities consistently mentioned in Enhanced Risk include Russellville, Conway, and Fort Smith, with some disagreement on placements of other cities.
- Consistently placed in the Slight Risk are Texarkana, Pine Bluff, and El Dorado, also with disagreements on other cities.
uniqueness:
- The focus on Arkansas with a bold or black outline is unique to Claude.
- Gemini uniquely notes cities like Hot Springs, Little Rock, West Memphis, and Arkadelphia in the discussions of various risk zones.
- Claude and Gemini together detail the Marginal Risk as covering the eastern and western borders or extending beyond other severe areas across the state, while GPT provides a less specific description.
disagreement:
- There are significant disagreements in which cities fall under the categories of Enhanced and Slight Risk. Gemini places more emphasis on cities being in Moderate or Enhanced Risk (e.g., Mountain Home, Harrison, Batesville) compared to GPT and Claude.
- GPT mentions no cities entirely within High Risk (Red), whereas Gemini points to Mountain Home being close to a High-Risk border.
- One report (GPT) uses inconsistent color associations for risk levels.
- Contrasting views exist about the Thunderstorm area, which is described variably the outermost, far eastern, or at state corners, and one report states no areas were only marked for Thunderstorms (GPT).
